name: ChatApp
description: A real-time one-on-one chat application supporting image sharing, dynamic theming, and an online users filter. Built on the robust MERN stack, ChatApp provides seamless and secure communication with a modern, responsive interface.
context: This project was developed as a practical full-stack exercise to explore real-time communication features using web sockets, user interaction dynamics, and media uploads in a scalable web environment.

technologiesUsed.name: MongoDB
technologiesUsed.purpose: Used as the main database for storing users and messages.

technologiesUsed.name: Express.js
technologiesUsed.purpose: Served as the backend web framework to handle routing, middleware, and API logic.

technologiesUsed.name: React.js
technologiesUsed.purpose: Built the frontend interface using components, state management, and hooks for responsiveness and interactivity.

technologiesUsed.name: Node.js
technologiesUsed.purpose: Provided the JavaScript runtime environment for the server and handled asynchronous operations.

technologiesUsed.name: Socket.io
technologiesUsed.purpose: Enabled real-time, bidirectional communication between clients for instant messaging functionality.

technologiesUsed.name: Cloudinary
technologiesUsed.purpose: Managed and hosted image uploads shared during conversations, ensuring fast and secure media delivery.

technologiesUsed.name: TailwindCSS & DaisyUI
technologiesUsed.purpose: Handled styling and theme switching with built-in utility classes and ready-made components.

name: LexiFlash
description: A vocabulary learning application designed for individual users. Utilizing vocabulary lists and flashcards, it aims to facilitate effective language learning. Unlike many other vocabulary building apps, LexiFlash offers unique features, including personalized vocabulary sets and immediate feedback on incorrect answers. This ensures a customized learning experience, allowing users to create their own vocabulary lists and review correct answers before making another attempt.
context: This project was a final boothcamp validation project designed to offer an easy-to-use vocabulary learning solution directly in the browser, with no installation required.

technologiesUsed.name: JavaScript & Webpack
technologiesUsed.purpose: Structured code modularly for efficient web application development.

technologiesUsed.name: SASS & Parcel
technologiesUsed.purpose: For responsive styling and seamless development workflow.

technologiesUsed.name: Supabase
technologiesUsed.purpose: Used as an external database server to manage and store project data. It provided real-time data synchronization and streamlined back-end operations, ensuring efficient data handling and seamless integration with the application.

technologiesUsed.name: React
technologiesUsed.purpose: Used to build the application's user interface with a component-based architecture. It enabled efficient rendering, dynamic updates, and the creation of a responsive and interactive user experience.

name: Bestshop
description: For this project, I developed an interactive calculator that dynamically updates pricing based on user inputs. The calculator handles various events like changes, clicks, and focus/blur actions to provide a seamless user experience.
context: This project was part of a Coders Lab workshop focused on reinforcing JavaScript skills through practical application. It involved creating a user-friendly tool to enhance the BestShop website's functionality.

technologiesUsed.purpose: For DOM manipulation and real-time updates.
